lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/gigachad.gigachad.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run gigachad.gigachad.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a command that can be executed in the gigachad application.
* This class parses and executes various user commands for task management, including
* adding, deleting, marking, and listing tasks.

* @param storage the storage system for persisting tasks
* @throws GigachadException if the command execution fails due to invalid input or other errors

* Creates the parent directories if they do not exist, creates the storage file if storage file does not exist
* and parses existing task data from the file format:
* "D | isDone | description | deadlineDateTime" for Deadline tasks
* "E | isDone | description | startDateTime - endDateTime" for Event tasks
* Prints initialisation status and current task list to console.
* Handles corrupted file formats by catching and printing error messages.

* Saves all tasks from the given TaskList to the storage file.

* Each task is written in its save format on a separate line.

* Handles all user interface interactions for the gigachad application.

* Displays goodbye message to user when user exits application.
* Closes scanner to free up resources.

* Displays message indicating that task has been marked complete.
* @param task the task that was marked complete

System.out.println("I already marked this task as done!");
* Displays message indicating that task has been marked incomplete.

System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as undone:");
